vulnerabilities.title: Security Features
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `apparmor` package and not the `apparmor` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

In all versions of AppArmor mount rules are accidentally widened when compiled.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `apparmor`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-1585)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-1585)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `aspell` package and not the `aspell` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

libaspell.a in GNU Aspell before 0.60.8 has a buffer over-read for a string ending with a single '\0' byte, if the encoding is set to ucs-2 or ucs-4 outside of the application, as demonstrated by the ASPELL_CONF environment variable.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `aspell`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20433)
- [MISC](http://aspell.net/buffer-overread-ucs.txt)
vulnerabilities.name: aspell/libaspell15

vulnerabilities.title: Link Following
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `avahi` package and not the `avahi` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

avahi-daemon-check-dns.sh in the Debian avahi package through 0.8-4 is executed as root via /etc/network/if-up.d/avahi-daemon, and allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service or create arbitrary empty files via a symlink attack on files under /run/avahi-daemon. NOTE: this only affects the packaging for Debian GNU/Linux (used indirectly by SUSE), not the upstream Avahi product.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `avahi`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-26720)
- [MISC](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=982796)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/avahi/+bug/1870824)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1180827)
- [MISC](https://metadata.ftp-master.debian.org/changelogs/main/a/avahi/avahi_0.8-4_changelog)
- [MISC](https://packages.debian.org/bullseye/avahi-daemon)
- [MISC](https://packages.debian.org/buster/avahi-daemon)
- [MISC](https://packages.debian.org/sid/avahi-daemon)
- [MISC](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-26720)
- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/02/15/2)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/06/msg00009.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `cairo` package and not the `cairo` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

cairo through 1.15.14 has an out-of-bounds stack-memory write during processing of a crafted document by WebKitGTK+ because of the interaction between cairo-rectangular-scan-converter.c (the generate and render_rows functions) and cairo-image-compositor.c (the _cairo_image_spans_and_zero function).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `cairo`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-18064)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18064)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/cairo/cairo/issues/341)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
vulnerabilities.name: cairo/libcairo-gobject2

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `coreutils` package and not the `coreutils` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `coreutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability exists in curl <v7.88.0 based on the "chained" HTTP compression algorithms, meaning that a server response can be compressed multiple times and potentially with differentalgorithms. The number of acceptable "links" in this "decompression chain" wascapped, but the cap was implemented on a per-header basis allowing a maliciousserver to insert a virtually unlimited number of compression steps simply byusing many headers. The use of such a decompression chain could result in a "malloc bomb", making curl end up spending enormous amounts of allocated heap memory, or trying to and returning out of memory errors.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.23 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-23916)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1826048)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/02/msg00035.html)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BQKE6TXYDHOTFHLTBZ5X73GTKI7II5KO/)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://www.debian.org/security/2023/dsa-5365)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20230309-0006/)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27535
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl <8.0.0 in the FTP connection reuse feature that can result in wrong credentials being used during subsequent transfers. Previously created connections are kept in a connection pool for reuse if they match the current setup. However, certain FTP settings such as CURLOPT_FTP_ACCOUNT, CURLOPT_FTP_ALTERNATIVE_TO_USER, CURLOPT_FTP_SSL_CCC, and CURLOPT_USE_SSL were not included in the configuration match checks, causing them to match too easily. This could lead to libcurl using the wrong credentials when performing a transfer, potentially allowing unauthorized access to sensitive information.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27535)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892780)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27534
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A path traversal vulnerability exists in curl <8.0.0 SFTP implementation causes the tilde (~) character to be wrongly replaced when used as a prefix in the first path element, in addition to its intended use as the first element to indicate a path relative to the user's home directory. Attackers can exploit this flaw to bypass filtering or execute arbitrary code by crafting a path like /~2/foo while accessing a server with a specific user.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27534)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892351)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27538
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl v8.0.0 where it reuses a previously established SSH connection despite the fact that an SSH option was modified, which should have prevented reuse. libcurl maintains a pool of previously used connections to reuse them for subsequent transfers if the configurations match. However, two SSH settings were omitted from the configuration check, allowing them to match easily, potentially leading to the reuse of an inappropriate connection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27538)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1898475)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27533
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A vulnerability in input validation exists in curl <8.0 during communication using the TELNET protocol may allow an attacker to pass on maliciously crafted user name and "telnet options" during server negotiation. The lack of proper input scrubbing allows an attacker to send content or perform option negotiation without the application's intent. This vulnerability could be exploited if an application allows user input, thereby enabling attackers to execute arbitrary code on the system.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27533)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1891474)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27536
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists libcurl <8.0.0 in the connection reuse feature which can reuse previously established connections with incorrect user permissions due to a failure to check for changes in the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION option. This vulnerability affects krb5/kerberos/negotiate/GSSAPI transfers and could potentially result in unauthorized access to sensitive information. The safest option is to not reuse connections if the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION option has been changed.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27536)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1895135)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability exists in curl <v7.88.0 based on the "chained" HTTP compression algorithms, meaning that a server response can be compressed multiple times and potentially with differentalgorithms. The number of acceptable "links" in this "decompression chain" wascapped, but the cap was implemented on a per-header basis allowing a maliciousserver to insert a virtually unlimited number of compression steps simply byusing many headers. The use of such a decompression chain could result in a "malloc bomb", making curl end up spending enormous amounts of allocated heap memory, or trying to and returning out of memory errors.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.23 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-23916)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1826048)

vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27535
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl <8.0.0 in the FTP connection reuse feature that can result in wrong credentials being used during subsequent transfers. Previously created connections are kept in a connection pool for reuse if they match the current setup. However, certain FTP settings such as CURLOPT_FTP_ACCOUNT, CURLOPT_FTP_ALTERNATIVE_TO_USER, CURLOPT_FTP_SSL_CCC, and CURLOPT_USE_SSL were not included in the configuration match checks, causing them to match too easily. This could lead to libcurl using the wrong credentials when performing a transfer, potentially allowing unauthorized access to sensitive information.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27535)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892780)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27534
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A path traversal vulnerability exists in curl <8.0.0 SFTP implementation causes the tilde (~) character to be wrongly replaced when used as a prefix in the first path element, in addition to its intended use as the first element to indicate a path relative to the user's home directory. Attackers can exploit this flaw to bypass filtering or execute arbitrary code by crafting a path like /~2/foo while accessing a server with a specific user.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27534)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892351)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27538
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl v8.0.0 where it reuses a previously established SSH connection despite the fact that an SSH option was modified, which should have prevented reuse. libcurl maintains a pool of previously used connections to reuse them for subsequent transfers if the configurations match. However, two SSH settings were omitted from the configuration check, allowing them to match easily, potentially leading to the reuse of an inappropriate connection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27538)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1898475)

_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl v8.0.0 where it reuses a previously established SSH connection despite the fact that an SSH option was modified, which should have prevented reuse. libcurl maintains a pool of previously used connections to reuse them for subsequent transfers if the configurations match. However, two SSH settings were omitted from the configuration check, allowing them to match easily, potentially leading to the reuse of an inappropriate connection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27538)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1898475)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4-openssl-dev

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27533
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A vulnerability in input validation exists in curl <8.0 during communication using the TELNET protocol may allow an attacker to pass on maliciously crafted user name and "telnet options" during server negotiation. The lack of proper input scrubbing allows an attacker to send content or perform option negotiation without the application's intent. This vulnerability could be exploited if an application allows user input, thereby enabling attackers to execute arbitrary code on the system.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27533)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1891474)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4-openssl-dev

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27536
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists libcurl <8.0.0 in the connection reuse feature which can reuse previously established connections with incorrect user permissions due to a failure to check for changes in the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION option. This vulnerability affects krb5/kerberos/negotiate/GSSAPI transfers and could potentially result in unauthorized access to sensitive information. The safest option is to not reuse connections if the CURLOPT_GSSAPI_DELEGATION option has been changed.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27536)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1895135)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl4-openssl-dev

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability exists in curl <v7.88.0 based on the "chained" HTTP compression algorithms, meaning that a server response can be compressed multiple times and potentially with differentalgorithms. The number of acceptable "links" in this "decompression chain" wascapped, but the cap was implemented on a per-header basis allowing a maliciousserver to insert a virtually unlimited number of compression steps simply byusing many headers. The use of such a decompression chain could result in a "malloc bomb", making curl end up spending enormous amounts of allocated heap memory, or trying to and returning out of memory errors.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.23 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-23916)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1826048)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/02/msg00035.html)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BQKE6TXYDHOTFHLTBZ5X73GTKI7II5KO/)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://www.debian.org/security/2023/dsa-5365)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20230309-0006/)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl3-gnutls

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27535
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in libcurl <8.0.0 in the FTP connection reuse feature that can result in wrong credentials being used during subsequent transfers. Previously created connections are kept in a connection pool for reuse if they match the current setup. However, certain FTP settings such as CURLOPT_FTP_ACCOUNT, CURLOPT_FTP_ALTERNATIVE_TO_USER, CURLOPT_FTP_SSL_CCC, and CURLOPT_USE_SSL were not included in the configuration match checks, causing them to match too easily. This could lead to libcurl using the wrong credentials when performing a transfer, potentially allowing unauthorized access to sensitive information.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27535)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892780)
vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl3-gnutls

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2023-27534
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A path traversal vulnerability exists in curl <8.0.0 SFTP implementation causes the tilde (~) character to be wrongly replaced when used as a prefix in the first path element, in addition to its intended use as the first element to indicate a path relative to the user's home directory. Attackers can exploit this flaw to bypass filtering or execute arbitrary code by crafting a path like /~2/foo while accessing a server with a specific user.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `curl` to version 7.58.0-2ubuntu3.24 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2023-27534)
- [support@hackerone.com](https://hackerone.com/reports/1892351)

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libavutil55

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

A null pointer dereference issue was discovered in 'FFmpeg' in decode_main_header() function of libavformat/nutdec.c file. The flaw occurs because the function lacks check of the return value of avformat_new_stream() and triggers the null pointer dereference error, causing an application to crash.

There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 due to a memory leak in the av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags function in buffersrc.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-22041)
- [MISC](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8296)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00012.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libavutil55

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description

A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

A null pointer dereference issue was discovered in 'FFmpeg' in decode_main_header() function of libavformat/nutdec.c file. The flaw occurs because the function lacks check of the return value of avformat_new_stream() and triggers the null pointer dereference error, causing an application to crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2022-3341)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)

There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

- [MISC](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8296)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libswresample2

A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 due to a memory leak in the av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags function in buffersrc.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

- [MISC](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8296)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00012.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libavcodec57

A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 due to a memory leak in the av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags function in buffersrc.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

- [MISC](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8296)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00012.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libavresample3

A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 due to a memory leak in the av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags function in buffersrc.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

- [MISC](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8296)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)
vulnerabilities.name: ffmpeg/libswscale4

A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-3566
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00018.html)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ffmpeg` package and not the `ffmpeg` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe' function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file that references an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, the contents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim (as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ffmpeg`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3566)
- [MISC](https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/3bce9e9b3ea35c54bacccc793d7da99ea5157532#diff-74f6b92a0541378ad15de9c29c0a2b0c69881ad9ffc71abe568b88b535e00a7f)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `gcc-7` package and not the `gcc-7` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `gcc-7`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13844)

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ghostscript` package and not the `ghostscript` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) in opj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile in openjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ghostscript`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-6988)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6988)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1178)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106785)
vulnerabilities.name: ghostscript/libgs9

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ghostscript` package and not the `ghostscript` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in openjpeg in color.c:379:42 in sycc420_to_rgb when decompressing a crafted .j2k file. An attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the application compiled against openjpeg.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ghostscript`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-3575)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1957616)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1347)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2021-3575)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `ghostscript` package and not the `ghostscript` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenJPEG 2.3.0. It allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (attempted excessive memory allocation) in opj_calloc in openjp2/opj_malloc.c, when called from opj_tcd_init_tile in openjp2/tcd.c, as demonstrated by the 64-bit opj_decompress.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `ghostscript`.

- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1178)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106785)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `git` package and not the `git` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

GIT version 2.15.1 and earlier contains a Input Validation Error vulnerability in Client that can result in problems including messing up terminal configuration to RCE. This attack appear to be exploitable via The user must interact with a malicious git server, (or have their traffic modified in a MITM attack).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `git`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000021)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000021)
- [http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html](http://www.batterystapl.es/2018/01/security-implications-of-ansi-escape.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-33574)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KJYYIMDDYOHTP2PORLABTOHYQYYREZDD/)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/10/msg00021.html)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-20013)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://twitter.com/solardiz/status/795601240151457793)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://pthree.org/2018/05/23/do-not-use-sha256crypt-sha512crypt-theyre-dangerous/)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://akkadia.org/drepper/SHA-crypt.txt)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2009-5155)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Data Handling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-33574)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KJYYIMDDYOHTP2PORLABTOHYQYYREZDD/)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/10/msg00021.html)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-20013)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://twitter.com/solardiz/status/795601240151457793)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://pthree.org/2018/05/23/do-not-use-sha256crypt-sha512crypt-theyre-dangerous/)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://akkadia.org/drepper/SHA-crypt.txt)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2009-5155)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K64119434)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `glibc` package and not the `glibc` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `glibc`.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `gnupg2` package and not the `gnupg2` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

GnuPG can be made to spin on a relatively small input by (for example) crafting a public key with thousands of signatures attached, compressed down to just a few KB.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `gnupg2`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `gnupg2` package and not the `gnupg2` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

GnuPG can be made to spin on a relatively small input by (for example) crafting a public key with thousands of signatures attached, compressed down to just a few KB.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `gnupg2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2022-3219)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2022-3219)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2127010)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://dev.gnupg.org/D556)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5993)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://marc.info/?l=oss-security&m=165696590211434&w=4)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20230324-0001/)
vulnerabilities.name: gnupg2/gnupg

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `gnutls28` package and not the `gnutls28` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `gnutls28`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `imagemagick` package and not the `imagemagick` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27752)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894226)
vulnerabilities.name: imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `imagemagick` package and not the `imagemagick` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

In WriteOnePNGImage() of the PNG coder at coders/png.c, an improper call to AcquireVirtualMemory() and memset() allows for an out-of-bounds write later when PopShortPixel() from MagickCore/quantum-private.h is called. The patch fixes the calls by adding 256 to rowbytes. An attacker who is able to supply a specially crafted image could affect availability with a low impact to data integrity. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-68 and 7.0.8-68.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-25664)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891605)
- [secalert@redhat.com](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/Z3J6D7POCQYQKNVRDYLTTPM5SQC3WVTR/)
vulnerabilities.name: imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-3

vulnerabilities.title: XML Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `imagemagick` package and not the `imagemagick` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

ImageMagick before 6.9.11-40 and 7.x before 7.0.10-40 mishandles the -authenticate option, which allows setting a password for password-protected PDF files. The user-controlled password was not properly escaped/sanitized and it was therefore possible to inject additional shell commands via coders/pdf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29599)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-36)
- [MISC](https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/discussions/2851)
- [MISC](https://insert-script.blogspot.com/2020/11/imagemagick-shell-injection-via-pdf.html)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/01/msg00010.html)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/03/msg00008.html)
vulnerabilities.name: imagemagick/libmagickcore-6.q16-3

ImageMagick before 6.9.11-40 and 7.x before 7.0.10-40 mishandles the -authenticate option, which allows setting a password for password-protected PDF files. The user-controlled password was not properly escaped/sanitized and it was therefore possible to inject additional shell commands via coders/pdf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.

A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27752)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `imagemagick` package and not the `imagemagick` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

In WriteOnePNGImage() of the PNG coder at coders/png.c, an improper call to AcquireVirtualMemory() and memset() allows for an out-of-bounds write later when PopShortPixel() from MagickCore/quantum-private.h is called. The patch fixes the calls by adding 256 to rowbytes. An attacker who is able to supply a specially crafted image could affect availability with a low impact to data integrity. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-68 and 7.0.8-68.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `imagemagick` package and not the `imagemagick` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `imagemagick`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27752)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894226)

In WriteOnePNGImage() of the PNG coder at coders/png.c, an improper call to AcquireVirtualMemory() and memset() allows for an out-of-bounds write later when PopShortPixel() from MagickCore/quantum-private.h is called. The patch fixes the calls by adding 256 to rowbytes. An attacker who is able to supply a specially crafted image could affect availability with a low impact to data integrity. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-68 and 7.0.8-68.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-13351
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `jackd2` package and not the `jackd2` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

posix/JackSocket.cpp in libjack in JACK2 1.9.1 through 1.9.12 (as distributed with alsa-plugins 1.1.7 and later) has a "double file descriptor close" issue during a failed connection attempt when jackd2 is not running. Exploitation success depends on multithreaded timing of that double close, which can result in unintended information disclosure, crashes, or file corruption due to having the wrong file associated with the file descriptor.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `jackd2`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13351)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13351)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/xbmc/xbmc/issues/16258)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/jackaudio/jack2/pull/480)
vulnerabilities.name: jackd2/libjack-jackd2-0

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

ec_verify in kdc/kdc_preauth_ec.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.4 and 1.19.x before 1.19.2 allows remote attackers to cause a NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash. This occurs because a return value is not properly managed in a certain situation.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5` to version 1.16-2ubuntu0.4 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2021-36222)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fc98f520caefff2e5ee9a0026fdf5109944b3562)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4944)
- [MISC](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/releases)
- [MISC](https://web.mit.edu/kerberos/advisories/)
- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211022-0003/)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211104-0007/)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libk5crypto3

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.5 and 1.19.x before 1.19.3 has a NULL pointer dereference in kdc/do_tgs_req.c via a FAST inner body that lacks a server field.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5` to version 1.16-2ubuntu0.4 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5`.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.5 and 1.19.x before 1.19.3 has a NULL pointer dereference in kdc/do_tgs_req.c via a FAST inner body that lacks a server field.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5` to version 1.16-2ubuntu0.4 or higher.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5`.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5`.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

ec_verify in kdc/kdc_preauth_ec.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.18.4 and 1.19.x before 1.19.2 allows remote attackers to cause a NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash. This occurs because a return value is not properly managed in a certain situation.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5` to version 1.16-2ubuntu0.4 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `krb5` package and not the `krb5` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `krb5`.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `lapack` package and not the `lapack` package as distributed by `Ubuntu:18.04`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Ubuntu:18.04` relevant fixed versions and status._

An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the CLARRV, DLARRV, SLARRV, and ZLARRV functions in lapack through version 3.10.0, as also used in OpenBLAS before version 0.3.18. Specially crafted inputs passed to these functions could cause an application using lapack to crash or possibly disclose portions of its memory.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Ubuntu:18.04` `lapack`.
